explainability.findings: Technical papers list key AI system attributes and approaches to achieve explainability.
explainability.path_to_improvement: Publish user-facing explanation interfaces or documented appeal workflows.

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper, "Qualcomm Response to NIST Request for Information on AI Standards," provides evidence for the **transparency**, **explainability**, **privacy**, **fairness**, and **governance** pillars of responsible AI. It supports transparency and explainability by listing key AI system attributes and approaches to achieve them, and addresses privacy by discussing standardizing data structure, storage, security, and integrity for AI applications. Furthermore, the paper indicates a commitment to fairness by mentioning the removal of biases in machine learning and supports governance by recommending standards and workflows for policy discussions.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm Response to NIST Request for Information on AI Standards

external_accountability.findings: Policy documents state a commitment to defining technical standards and certifying AI content provenance via engagement with standards bodies and partners. Reports demonstrate external accountability through supplier requirements and audits.
external_accountability.path_to_improvement: Publish third-party audit results, certifications, or regulatory compliance documentation.

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Qualcomm Responsible AI Principles," provides evidence for **external_accountability**, **fairness**, **governance**, and **privacy**. It supports **governance** by detailing a multidisciplinary group monitoring AI regulations and aligning governance. The document also touches on **privacy** and **fairness** by stating aspirations regarding AI privacy/security risks and fairness/inclusivity, though without execution details. Furthermore, it supports **external_accountability** through a commitment to defining technical standards and certifying AI content provenance via engagement with standards bodies and partners.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm Responsible AI Principles

relevant_sources.summary: The 2024 Qualcomm Corporate Responsibility Report provides evidence for **governance**, **external accountability**, **transparency**, and **privacy**. The report details Qualcomm's governance structure for ESG and responsible AI, including board oversight and committee structures. It demonstrates external accountability through supplier requirements and audits, and transparency by highlighting AI-based solutions, generative AI use cases, and AI products. Furthermore, the report supports the privacy pillar by outlining privacy and cybersecurity training metrics and mentioning privacy as a fundamental aspect of their responsible AI principles.
relevant_sources.title: 2024 Qualcomm Corporate Responsibility Report

fairness.findings: Policy documents state aspirations regarding fairness and inclusivity for AI. Technical papers mention the removal of biases in machine learning.
fairness.path_to_improvement: Publish bias testing results, outcome monitoring, or vendor fairness certifications.

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Qualcomm Responsible AI Principles," provides evidence for **external_accountability**, **fairness**, **governance**, and **privacy**. It supports **governance** by detailing a multidisciplinary group monitoring AI regulations and aligning governance. relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper, "Qualcomm Response to NIST Request for Information on AI Standards," provides evidence for the **transparency**, **explainability**, **privacy**, **fairness**, and **governance** pillars of responsible AI. It supports transparency and explainability by listing key AI system attributes and approaches to achieve them, and addresses privacy by discussing standardizing data structure, storage, security, and integrity for AI applications. Furthermore, the paper indicates a commitment to fairness by mentioning the removal of biases in machine learning and supports governance by recommending standards and workflows for policy discussions.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm Response to NIST Request for Information on AI Standards

governance.findings: Qualcomm's policy documents detail a multidisciplinary group monitoring AI regulations and aligning governance, while reports outline the company's governance structure for ESG and responsible AI, including board oversight and committee structures. SEC filings discuss AI development, commercialization, strategic investments, and the management of AI-related cybersecurity risks, indicating oversight and policy considerations. The company's commitment to the Rome Call for AI Ethics and its Responsible AI Principles aligns with ethical principles, and press releases detail plans for AI governance tools to ensure responsible AI management and deployment.

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Qualcomm Responsible AI Principles," provides evidence for **external_accountability**, **fairness**, **governance**, and **privacy**. Furthermore, it supports **external_accountability** through a commitment to defining technical standards and certifying AI content provenance via engagement with standards bodies and partners.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm Responsible AI Principles

relevant_sources.summary: The 2024 Qualcomm Corporate Responsibility Report provides evidence for **governance**, **external accountability**, **transparency**, and **privacy**. The report details Qualcomm's governance structure for ESG and responsible AI, including board oversight and committee structures. It demonstrates external accountability through supplier requirements and audits, and transparency by highlighting AI-based solutions, generative AI use cases, and AI products. Furthermore, the report supports the privacy pillar by outlining privacy and cybersecurity training metrics and mentioning privacy as a fundamental aspect of their responsible AI principles.
relevant_sources.title: 2024 Qualcomm Corporate Responsibility Report

relevant_sources.summary: This SEC filing, "Form 10-K Fiscal Year 2024," provides evidence for the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars of responsible AI. The document supports governance by discussing AI development, commercialization, strategic investments, and the management of AI-related cybersecurity risks, indicating oversight and policy considerations. Evidence for privacy is found in mentions of privacy benefits for AI use cases and data protection efforts. Transparency is supported through descriptions of AI software portfolios, developer support, AI platforms, generative AI algorithms, and AI Hubs for model deployment, which detail AI capabilities and use cases.
relevant_sources.title: Form 10-K Fiscal Year 2024

relevant_sources.summary: This press release announces Qualcomm's commitment to the Rome Call for AI Ethics, providing evidence for the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars. The company's signature signifies a commitment to developing AI that respects privacy and minimizes harm, aligning with ethical principles and their own Responsible AI Principles. This commitment is further supported by the signatories' pledge to invest in "algorethics," which encompasses principles like transparency and accountability.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm Signs the Rome Call for AI Ethics

relevant_sources.summary: This technical paper, "Qualcomm Response to NIST Request for Information on AI Standards," provides evidence for the **transparency**, **explainability**, **privacy**, **fairness**, and **governance** pillars of responsible AI. It supports transparency and explainability by listing key AI system attributes and approaches to achieve them, and addresses privacy by discussing standardizing data structure, storage, security, and integrity for AI applications. Furthermore, the paper indicates a commitment to fairness by mentioning the removal of biases in machine learning and supports governance by recommending standards and workflows for policy discussions.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm Response to NIST Request for Information on AI Standards

relevant_sources.summary: This news coverage of Qualcomm's Rome Call for AI Ethics signature supports the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars. The source indicates Qualcomm's commitment to developing AI responsibly, aligning with governance principles through their stated "Responsible AI Principles" and a CEO statement that the initiative complements their core mission. Evidence for privacy is found in the mention of respecting privacy, and transparency is supported by the listing of commitments to AI principles like transparency and accountability.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm Backs Rome Call AI Ethics Programme

relevant_sources.summary: This press release provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. It highlights the collaboration between Qualcomm and IBM to integrate watsonx.governance with Qualcomm platforms, emphasizing robust governance, monitoring, and guardrails for controlling AI deployments and operations. The announcement details plans for AI governance tools to ensure responsible AI management and deployment across environments.
relevant_sources.title: Qualcomm and IBM Scale Enterprise-Grade Generative AI Collaboration

relevant_sources.summary: This coverage of Qualcomm's CES announcements supports the **governance**, **privacy**, and **transparency** pillars. The source highlights Qualcomm's emphasis on on-device AI, which directly supports the **privacy** pillar by detailing how processing data locally enhances user privacy and reduces data exposure. Evidence for **governance** is found in mentions of a shift towards autonomous systems and policy commitments related to security and privacy. While the source describes AI capabilities and deployments, it lacks detailed execution or formal commitments, offering limited evidence for **transparency** beyond the general description of AI functionalities.
relevant_sources.title: CES 2026: Qualcomm Unveils Future of Intelligence

oversight.path_to_improvement: Document human review processes for AI-assisted decisions (built or vendor AI).

privacy.findings: Qualcomm's policy documents state aspirations regarding AI privacy and security risks, with reports outlining privacy and cybersecurity training metrics and mentioning privacy as a fundamental principle. SEC filings reference privacy benefits for AI use cases and data protection efforts, while technical papers discuss standardizing data structure, storage, security, and integrity for AI applications. The company's commitment to the Rome Call for AI Ethics and emphasis on on-device AI, including generative AI technology, signifies a commitment to developing AI that respects privacy by processing data locally to enhance user privacy and reduce data exposure.
privacy.path_to_improvement: Publish AI-specific privacy impact assessments or data handling procedures.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned blog post, "Preserving Privacy and Security in a Generative AI World," provides evidence for the **privacy** pillar. The post discusses how on-device generative AI technology can enhance privacy by keeping sensitive personal information local and utilizing data on the device, thereby improving security and preserving user privacy.
relevant_sources.title: Preserving Privacy and Security in a Generative AI World

The company's commitment to the Rome Call for AI Ethics includes a pledge to invest in "algorethics" encompassing transparency. Technical papers list key AI system attributes and approaches to achieve transparency, and news coverage references commitments to AI principles, including transparency.

summary.overall_findings: Qualcomm's reports highlight AI-based solutions, generative AI use cases, and AI products, demonstrating operational practices for transparency. Policy documents further detail a multidisciplinary group monitoring AI regulations for governance, and published materials outline privacy and cybersecurity training metrics. Fairness, explainability, and external accountability are also addressed at the policy level, with technical papers mentioning the removal of biases in machine learning and reports demonstrating external accountability through supplier requirements and audits. Overall, these disclosures address 6 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, though no qualifying public evidence was found for oversight. This assessment draws on 15 publicly available sources.
